alert.note: Alert for Berkeley; Eastern Mineral; Hampshire; Hardy; Jefferson; Morgan; Western Mineral (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 05 at 9:31AM EST until January 06 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 7 AM TO 7 PM EST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Heavy mixed precipitation expected. Total snow and sleet accumulations of 3 to 6 inches, except 1 to 3 inches over the lower elevations of the central Shenandoah Valley. Ice accumulations of one-tenth to one-quarter of an inch, with the highest potential for ice over the central Shenandoah Valley and northern Virginia Blue Ridge Mountains. * WHERE...Portions of western Maryland, northwest and western Virginia, and eastern West Virginia. * WHEN...From 7 AM to 7 PM EST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Precipitation is expected to begin as snow between 7 and 10 AM. The snow will mix with and then change to sleet and freezing rain between 10 AM and 1 PM over the central Shenandoah Valley and northern Virginia Blue Ridge Mountains. Precipitation may mix with sleet elsewhere after 1 PM, before ending during the early evening.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. When venturing outside, watch your first few steps taken on steps, sidewalks, and driveways, which could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.
